commit_message:
Add raw results for Cobbler results.

 - Results for Cobbler installation when
   lpxelinux downloads kernel via http.
 - Results for Cobbler installation when
   lpxelinux downloads kernel via tftp.
Change-Id: I3cfa2e28e1b1dc05637b9d6d2c51a755e715ca2c

commit_message:
dispacher/gnocchi: measures sent fix logging

Currently, the logging is only done when measures are posted on retry. If it
works on the first call, no logging is done. This can be confusing for users
that try to debug the Gnocchi dispatcher.

Change-Id: Ife7879fe0c153cec1a79c7d57529fda82b7b7c16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/25/323725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

is using nonstable tempest interfaces and these interfaces are changed.
QA team defines interfaces which are not under tempest.lib as unstable
clearly according to

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/library.rst#stability

So current test way is against the QA policy, so here is a workaround.
Copy&paste is not good, almost wrong. However, if still continuing the
tests, it would be a nice option to copy&paste and pass the gate test.
After QA team defines stable interfaces, that is a nice time to switch
using the stable interfaces with removing this copy&paste code.

Closes-Bug: #1589426

Depends-On: I3abd9049560ee507b3610ab482c697a239f13a3b

+

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 8fcbc8de4ea878bdec1ef8754eaf965e176854b3)

Change-Id: I30266f1b690ea105511d9b1162755bcc85e2e69a
'}]
commit_message:
Copy images_client from tempest + Correct concurrency of gabbi 1.22.0

Now the gate test of ceilometer is broken, because the ceilometer test
is using nonstable tempest interfaces and these interfaces are changed.
QA team defines interfaces which are not under tempest.lib as unstable
clearly according to

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/library.rst#stability

So current test way is against the QA policy, so here is a workaround.
Copy&paste is not good, almost wrong. However, if still continuing the
tests, it would be a nice option to copy&paste and pass the gate test.
After QA team defines stable interfaces, that is a nice time to switch
using the stable interfaces with removing this copy&paste code.

Closes-Bug: #1589426

Depends-On: I3abd9049560ee507b3610ab482c697a239f13a3b
(cherry picked from commit 6c0b97b1e6fc03bdf84bf9b888761bd22ea0ad58)

+

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 8fcbc8de4ea878bdec1ef8754eaf965e176854b3)

Change-Id: I30266f1b690ea105511d9b1162755bcc85e2e69a

commit_message:
Hard-code deb-openstack-pkg-tools into upload job

Since the build and upload jobs for the deb-openstack-pkg-tools repo
are slightly special and not currently intended to be reused exactly
for other packaging repos, it's easier for now to hard-code the
project name and make the upload publisher specific to the upload
job using it. These can be broken back out into reusable/composable
macros if the jobs get turned into job-templates later, but for now
there's only one repo anyway.

Also stop retaining the source directory hierarchy and just treat
the destination as a flat arrangement of files instead.

Change-Id: Ib0427b0a999b0b5e5021f44c4f5746691b3863a9

commit_message:
Rename gabbits with _ to have - instead

A forthcoming version of gabbi will warn on the presence of _
in yaml filenames as it can cause issues with test grouping
in concurent situations.

Change-Id: Ida8ce49582d5b8d927858982fae9fdfc267e4be4

commit_message:
Add applied_patch context manager

Context manager setup patch before block and revert patch upon
completion of the block.

Usage:

    from octane.util import patch

    with patch.applied_patch(
            "patch_directory",
            "patch_file_1",
            "patch_file_2",
            ...,
            "patch_fiel_n"):
        # code block
        ...

Change-Id: Id7bc86c6db4e55a0758257f7ecbb2538b1765123
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/07/329907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import contextlib @contextlib.contextmanager def applied_patch(cwd, *patches): patch_apply(cwd, patches) try: yield finally: patch_apply(cwd, patches, revert=True)

commit_message:
Fix unwanted unmounting of /usr/share/oem

Creating specific partitions will cause a udev event to trigger,
causing systemd to attempt to mount the new partition at /usr/share/oem.

This mount will not succeed, but will unmount /usr/share/oem,
causing ironic-python-agent to die.

Masking this unit disables this behavior.

Change-Id: Ifea3482f36a354cbf988e6f6003f4284c5c2a21d
Closes-bug: #1592163
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/89/330789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: usr-share-oem.mount mask: true

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 18:17:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/89c2385b979d5171a26a0c573ba73f5f2a33b376', 'message': 'Change release model for Neutron *-aas services

The pace of development of these projects is such that
releasing at fixed dates seems no longer justified. More
info on [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/096281.html

Change-Id: I3e86210ffbeceec8783b58120367fb8cd8f162dc
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 20:03:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/3055818232dc4094218486c5b0bb23e19ec689e0', 'message': 'Change release model for Neutron *-aas services

The pace of development of these projects is such that
releasing at fixed dates seems no longer justified. More
info on [1].

This change is not meant to affect any other tag associated
to these projects, however because of lack of empirical
evidence that these support upgrades, assert:supports-upgrade
and assert:supports-rolling-upgrade have been dropped in
the process.

Eligibility for other tags may be assessed over time.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/096281.html

Change-Id: I3e86210ffbeceec8783b58120367fb8cd8f162dc
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-06 13:48:03.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/aaa3c15fc373d401c124e1d4ad58bfe3f0a16934', 'message': 'Revisit the Neutron list of repos

LBaaS, FWaaS, VPNaaS and Dynamic Routing are listed as
part of the Neutron deliverable. These components have
always been meant to be optionally deployed, and like
the other deliverables, they should be described
individually.

As a result, they each get their own tags depending
on the level of compliance with the tag definition.

Change-Id: I3e86210ffbeceec8783b58120367fb8cd8f162dc
'}]
commit_message:
Revisit the Neutron list of repos

LBaaS, FWaaS, VPNaaS and Dynamic Routing are listed as
part of the Neutron deliverable. These components have
always been meant to be optionally deployed, and like
the other deliverables, they should be described
individually.

As a result, they each get their own tags depending
on the level of compliance with the tag definition.

Change-Id: I3e86210ffbeceec8783b58120367fb8cd8f162dc

commit_message:
Add ability to override MTU for networks

* This patch make ability for override ML2/path_mtu into:
      quantum_settings:
        . . .
        L2:
          segmentation_type: tun
          path_mtu: 8000
          tunnel_id_ranges: 2:65535

Custom noop-test added fot cover this task.

Change-Id: Ibb4c984751cd234db4a481819e390a79c27545d0
Closes-bug: #1589944

subject: [user-guide] Reorganize SDK section
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 01:29:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/f3276d6ecb61afdfb9e9ddb1ab2afde570527fbd', 'message': "[user-guide] Reorganize SDK section

The current structure of SDK section is not well listed in the
toc tree. This commit moves the overview in sdk.rst to a sub page
sdk_overview.rst so that all subsections in SDK section are displayed
in the toc.

Also moves 'Create a legacy client object' page to upper level.
Previously this page is listed as a bullet in the authenticate page
so it was small. This change makes the page more highlighed.

Change-Id: I6414b748a77a6375423da38e52113b36359e5f7d
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 05:37:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/753fadf32730929bf5a6bfff18e46cb0b3542ffd', 'message': "[user-guide] Reorganize SDK section

The current structure of SDK section is not well listed in the
toc tree. This commit moves the overview in sdk.rst to a sub page
sdk_overview.rst so that all subsections in SDK section are displayed
in the toc.

Also moves 'Create a legacy client object' page to upper level.

commit_message:
[user-guide] Reorganize SDK section

The current structure of SDK section is not well listed in the
toc tree. This commit moves the overview in sdk.rst to a sub page
sdk_overview.rst so that all subsections in SDK section are displayed
in the toc.

Also moves 'Create a legacy client object' page to upper level.
Previously this page is listed as a bullet in the authenticate page
so it was small. This change makes the page more highlighed.

Change-Id: I6414b748a77a6375423da38e52113b36359e5f7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/92/330292/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======== Overview ======== OpenStack provides four different options for interacting with its APIs from Python, each targetting a slightly different user. - OpenStack SDK - shade - Per-project client libraries - Direct REST calls via keystoneauth You should also be familiar with: - RESTful web services - HTTP/1.1 - JSON and data serialization formats OpenStack SDK ------------- The `OpenStack Python Software Development Kit (SDK) <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/openstacksdk>`_ is used to write Python automation scripts that create and manage resources in your OpenStack cloud. The SDK implements Python bindings to the OpenStack API, which enables you to perform automation tasks in Python by making calls on Python objects, rather than making REST calls directly. New users should default to coding against the OpenStack SDK. shade ----- `shade <http://pypi.python.org/pypi/shade>`_ is a an abstraction library focused on hiding implementation differences between OpenStack clouds. While the OpenStack SDK presents a clean object interface to the underlying REST APIs, shade hides them if doing so is advantageous. If you plan on running the same python program against many OpenStack clouds, you may want to use shade - but if you need to access any features of a cloud that do not have an cloud-neutral abstraction mapping, you will be unable to do so with shade. Per-project client libraries ---------------------------- Each OpenStack project produces a client library that wraps its own REST API. Unless there is no other choice for some reason, the per-project libraries should be avoided. Direct REST calls via keystoneauth ---------------------------------- All of OpenStack's APIs are actually REST APIs. The `keystoneauth <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystoneauth>`_ library provides an object that looks very much like a `Session <http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#request-sessions>`_ object from the Python `requests <http://pypi.python.org/pypi/requests>`_ library that handles all of the authentication for you. If you are more comfortable just dealing with REST, or if there is a feature implemented in your cloud that has not seen support in any of the libraries yet, this option is for you. .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 2 sdk_install.rst sdk_authenticate.rst sdk_manage_images.rst sdk_assign_cors_headers.rst sdk_schedule_objects_for_deletion.rst sdk_configure_access_security_instances.rst sdk_neutron_apis.rst sdk_compute_apis.rst

commit_message:
New Project Quark Plugin

The goal of this is to provide an alternative to ML2 that
is scalable beyond the limits of ML2's capabilities today.
This is an unofficial plugin today but could be added under
stadium in the future.  But, to do so based on current
requirements, the advancement of quark needs to be done
out in the open, community based before it can be considered.

Change-Id: Id4f6aa2a2585750c9176f93bfa8927e5796ba6d3

Fix 'mongo_mysql_partition_preservation' test

Update the way the reinstalled node status is checked
in Galera cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1592815

added_lines:
#!/bin/bash OS_DISTRIBUTION=${OS_DISTRIBUTION:-ubuntu} OS_NETWORKING=${OS_NETWORKING:-opencontrail} OS_DEPLOYMENT=${OS_DEPLOYMENT:-single} OS_SYSTEM="${OS_DISTRIBUTION}_${OS_NETWORKING}_${OS_DEPLOYMENT}" SALT_SOURCE=${SALT_SOURCE:-pip} SALT_VERSION=${SALT_VERSION:-latest} FORMULA_SOURCE=${FORMULA_SOURCE:-git} if [ "$FORMULA_SOURCE" == "git" ]; then SALT_ENV="dev" elif [ "$FORMULA_SOURCE" == "pkg" ]; then SALT_ENV="prd" fi RECLASS_ADDRESS=${RECLASS_ADDRESS:-https://github.com/tcpcloud/openstack-salt-model.git} RECLASS_BRANCH=${RECLASS_BRANCH:-master} RECLASS_SYSTEM=${RECLASS_SYSTEM:-$OS_SYSTEM} CONFIG_HOSTNAME=${CONFIG_HOSTNAME:-config} CONFIG_DOMAIN=${CONFIG_DOMAIN:-openstack.local} CONFIG_HOST=${CONFIG_HOSTNAME}.${CONFIG_DOMAIN} CONFIG_ADDRESS=${CONFIG_ADDRESS:-10.10.10.200} echo -e "
Preparing base OS repository ...
" echo -e "deb [arch=amd64] http://apt.tcpcloud.eu/nightly/ trusty main security extra tcp" > /etc/apt/sources.list wget -O - http://apt.tcpcloud.eu/public.gpg | apt-key add - apt-get clean apt-get update echo -e "
Installing salt master ...
" if [ -x "`which invoke-rc.d 2>/dev/null`" -a -x "/etc/init.d/salt-minion" ] ; then apt-get purge -y salt-minion salt-common && apt-get autoremove -y fi apt-get install -y python-pip python-dev zlib1g-dev reclass git if [ "$SALT_VERSION" == "latest" ]; then pip install salt else pip install salt==$SALT_VERSION fi wget -O /etc/init.d/salt-master https://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/pkg-salt/salt.git/plain/debian/salt-master.init && chmod 755 /etc/init.d/salt-master ln -s /usr/local/bin/salt-master /usr/bin/salt-master [ ! -d /etc/salt/master.d ] && mkdir -p /etc/salt/master.d cat << 'EOF' > /etc/salt/master.d/master.conf file_roots: base: - /usr/share/salt-formulas/env pillar_opts: False open_mode: True reclass: &reclass storage_type: yaml_fs inventory_base_uri: /srv/salt/reclass ext_pillar: - reclass: *reclass master_tops: reclass: *reclass EOF wget -O /etc/init.d/salt-minion https://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/pkg-salt/salt.git/plain/debian/salt-minion.init && chmod 755 /etc/init.d/salt-minion ln -s /usr/local/bin/salt-minion /usr/bin/salt-minion [ ! -d /etc/salt/minion.d ] && mkdir -p /etc/salt/minion.d echo -e "master: 127.0.0.1
id: $CONFIG_HOST" > /etc/salt/minion.d/minion.conf echo "Configuring reclass ..." [ ! -d /etc/reclass ] && mkdir /etc/reclass cat << 'EOF' > /etc/reclass/reclass-config.yml storage_type: yaml_fs pretty_print: True output: yaml inventory_base_uri: /srv/salt/reclass EOF git clone ${RECLASS_ADDRESS} /srv/salt/reclass -b ${RECLASS_BRANCH} if [ ! -f "/srv/salt/reclass/nodes/${CONFIG_HOST}.yml" ]; then cat << EOF > /srv/salt/reclass/nodes/${CONFIG_HOST}.yml classes: - service.git.client - system.linux.system.single - system.openssh.client.workshop - system.salt.master.single - system.salt.master.formula.$FORMULA_SOURCE - system.reclass.storage.salt - system.reclass.storage.system.$RECLASS_SYSTEM parameters: _param: reclass_data_repository: "$RECLASS_ADDRESS" reclass_data_revision: $RECLASS_BRANCH salt_formula_branch: $FORMULA_BRANCH reclass_config_master: $CONFIG_ADDRESS single_address: $CONFIG_ADDRESS salt_master_host: 127.0.0.1 salt_master_base_environment: $SALT_ENV linux: system: name: $CONFIG_HOSTNAME domain: $CONFIG_DOMAIN EOF if [ "$SALT_VERSION" == "latest" ]; then cat << EOF >> /srv/salt/reclass/nodes/${CONFIG_HOST}.yml salt: master: accept_policy: open_mode source: engine: $SALT_SOURCE minion: source: engine: $SALT_SOURCE EOF else cat << EOF >> /srv/salt/reclass/nodes/${CONFIG_HOST}.yml salt: master: accept_policy: open_mode source: engine: $SALT_SOURCE version: $SALT_VERSION minion: source: engine: $SALT_SOURCE version: $SALT_VERSION EOF fi fi

commit_message:
Work around Nova blocking openstack-core stop

When we try to stop openstack-core-clone pacemaker resource, Nova
services still want to be started by Pacemaker, and crm_resource --wait
never returns.

`crm_resource --wait -VVV` keeps printing:

   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-nova-scheduler:0      (overcloud-controller-0)
   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-cinder-volume (overcloud-controller-0 - blocked)
   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-nova-api:0    (overcloud-controller-0)
   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-nova-conductor:0      (overcloud-controller-0)

This shouldn't happen as the whole Nova resource sub-chain depends on
openstack-core:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs constraint show | grep nova
  start openstack-core-clone then start openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone then start openstack-nova-api-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone then start openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-api-clone then start openstack-nova-scheduler-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-scheduler-clone then start openstack-nova-conductor-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  openstack-nova-api-clone with openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone (score:INFINITY)
  openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone with openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone (score:INFINITY)
  openstack-nova-scheduler-clone with openstack-nova-api-clone (score:INFINITY)
  openstack-nova-conductor-clone with openstack-nova-scheduler-clone (score:INFINITY)

Explicitly disabling and enabling the Nova resource sub-chain helps as a
workaround.

Root cause is probably https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1327469

Change-Id: I34e650121f5b4f2e024f1c2510e51c2a5c38a1ce
Partial-Bug: #1592776
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/82/330682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # stop openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone separately to work around # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1341350 pcs resource disable openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone check_resource openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone stopped 900 # start openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone separately to work around # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1341350 pcs resource enable openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone check_resource openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone started 900

commit_message:
Switches metering agent to stateless iptables

If state_less parameter is not specified then
neutron-postrouting-bottom rule goes up in POSTROUTING
chain, which causes premature NATing of traffic,
for ex. traffic between internal networks becomes NATed.

Closes-Bug: 1544508
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Belous <sbelous@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I2e0011237d50a59d417cfee01dcd5f9d0da2e7f5
(cherry picked from commit 5d2d1120fcdcd5977d3c760ac1520a841048d456)
(cherry picked from commit 695335bb360f07ed5ba813474f024cb0de05b7f6)

commit_message:
Use http_proxy_to_wsgi from oslo.middleware

Deprecate our custom usage of the HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO header in
favour of a standard middleware shared across all services. This will
enable us to support the newer forwarding standards.

Closes-Bug: #1590608
Change-Id: Iad628a863e55cbf20c89ef23ebc7527ba8e1a835

commit_message:
Create new QA project karma-subunit-reporter

This creates a new project for karma-subunit-reporter, a plugin for
JavaScript tests using the Karma runner to report results in subunit
format.

added_lines: - (Integer) Maximum size of an IP packet (MTU) that can traverse the underlying physical network infrastructure without fragmentation when using an overlay/tunnel protocol. Either set this to the same value as the global_physnet_mtu value or use it to explicitly specify a physical network MTU value that differs from the default global_physnet_mtu value. - (List) A list of mappings of physical networks to MTU values. The format of the mapping is <physnet>:<mtu val>. This mapping allows specifying a physical network MTU value that differs from the default global_physnet_mtu value.
deleted_lines: - (Integer) Maximum size of an IP packet (MTU) that can traverse the underlying physical network infrastructure without fragmentation. For instances using a self-service/private network, neutron subtracts the overlay protocol overhead from this value and provides it to instances via DHCP option 26. For example, using a value of 9000, DHCP provides 8950 to instances using a VXLAN network that contains 50 bytes of overhead. Using a value of 0 disables this feature and instances typically default to a 1500 MTU. Only impacts instances, not neutron network components such as bridges and routers. - (List) A list of mappings of physical networks to MTU values. The format of the mapping is <physnet>:<mtu val>. This mapping allows specifying a physical network MTU value that differs from the default segment_mtu value.

lxc-docker-1.6.2 which is currently used on slaves), because

subject: Add queue name to notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 12:51:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/3a6674a6c6a9ded16a27ea1ed5249a2a3605646c', 'message': 'Add queue name to notifications

Currently notifications from Zaqar are very consise and simply represent
messages. Example:
{'body': 'somemessage', 'ttl': 60}

But subscribers are likely to want queue information inside
notifications, if they subscribe to multiple queues.

The only option for subscribers to know from which queue each
notification was sent is to listen on many ports, and make each port
correspond to each particular queue, but it's very inconvenient.

This patch adds queue name to each notification to make notifications
look like this:
{'body': 'somemessage', 'ttl': 60, 'queue_name': 'somequeue'}

Since we only add a new key to JSON dictionary, this patch is backward
compatible.

This patch adds new test case "test_proper_notification_data".
It also modifies "test_mailto" and "test_webhook" test cases, so they
consider undeterministic behavior of "json.dumps" function, which
often serializes dictionaries in different order, making test assertions
sometimes fail.

Closes-Bug: 1535811
Change-Id: Ied5fa24fd973043eda643e09aac1d6c0f1500892

commit_message:
Add queue name to notifications

Currently notifications from Zaqar are very consise and simply represent
messages. Example:
{'body': 'somemessage', 'ttl': 60}

But subscribers are likely to want queue information inside
notifications, if they subscribe to multiple queues.

The only option for subscribers to know from which queue each
notification was sent is to listen on many ports, and make each port
correspond to each particular queue, but it's very inconvenient.

This patch adds queue name to each notification to make notifications
look like this:
{'body': 'somemessage', 'ttl': 60, 'queue_name': 'somequeue'}

Since we only add a new key to JSON dictionary, this patch is backward
compatible.

This patch adds new test case "test_proper_notification_data".
It also modifies "test_mailto" and "test_webhook" test cases, so they
consider undeterministic behavior of "json.dumps" function, which
often serializes dictionaries in different order, making test assertions
sometimes fail.

Closes-Bug: 1535811
Change-Id: Ied5fa24fd973043eda643e09aac1d6c0f1500892
(cherry picked from commit 1a0e8e719ad9948c4e7c60eabc980f36960e1446)

commit_message:
redis: do not force LuaLock

LuaLock are used automatically if available by the Redis client, so
let's enjoy that. If they are not available, it'll use standard locks
anyhow.

Change-Id: Iac82622bbbf05c9472fe2c62723d46ea18ba7e6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tooz refs/changes/22/322822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._lock = client.lock(name, timeout=timeout, thread_local=False)
deleted_lines: from redis import lock as redis_locks self._lock = redis_locks.LuaLock(client, name, timeout=timeout, thread_local=False)

commit_message:
Rename gabbits with _ to have - instead

A forthcoming version of gabbi will warn on the presence of _
in yaml filenames as it can cause issues with test grouping
in concurent situations.

Note that this issue has always been present, but I forgot to
make it super obvious or correct people when they did use _.

Change-Id: I1a7ff11dc062c88dbf6b13d93b2a82356969fea1

Add releasenotes for monasca period property

Change-Id: I28d24ff2880244d215d976a240c8998ba1826187
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/08/330908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add optional 'period' property for Monasca Notification resource. The new added property will now allow the user to tell Monasca the interval in seconds to periodically invoke a webhook until the ALARM state transitions back to an OK state or vice versa. This is useful when the user wants to create a stack which will automatically scale up or scale down more than once if the alarm state continues to be in the same state. To conform to the existing Heat autoscaling behaviour, we manually create the monasca notification resource in Heat with a default interval value of 60.

commit_message:
Added audit_template filter to /audits/detail

In this changeset, I added the 'audit_template' filter to the
/audits/detail endpoint so it has the same set of parameters as
the /audits endpoint.

Change-Id: I2568be18854bd97d4b7879532cb36a7cac532719

commit_message:
announce: make metatag optional

This allows the script to work even if the metatag are not present in
the git tag. It will then send a simple email announcing the release,
without any series information, with just the release information
between the PREVIOUS_VERSION and VERSION.

This will allow independent projects to be managed by this script
without going through openstack/releases.

Change-Id: I9881ad83d25a53db2d2c314d1accf847bb79aa8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/01/315101/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -n "$TAG_META" ]]; then function get_tag_meta { typeset fieldname="$1" echo "$TAG_META" | grep "^meta:$fieldname:" | cut -f2 -d' ' } # The series name is part of the commit message left by release.sh. SERIES=$(get_tag_meta series) series_opt="--series $SERIES" # The type of release this is. RELEASETYPE=$(get_tag_meta release-type) # Figure out if that series is a stable branch or not. We don't # release pre-releases on stable branches, so we only need to check # for stable if the release type is a normal release. if [[ $RELEASETYPE = "release" ]]; then if git branch -a | grep -q origin/stable/$SERIES; then stable="--stable" fi # If this is the first full release in a series, it isn't "stable" # yet. FIRST_FULL=$(get_tag_meta first) if [[ $FIRST_FULL = "yes" ]]; then stable="" fi # The recipient for announcements is part of the commit message left # by release.sh. ANNOUNCE=$(get_tag_meta announce) if [[ ! -z "$ANNOUNCE" ]]; then email_to="--email-to $ANNOUNCE" fi # Only include the PyPI link if we are told to. INCLUDE_PYPI_LINK=$(get_tag_meta pypi) if [[ "$INCLUDE_PYPI_LINK" == "yes" ]]; then include_pypi_link="--include-pypi-link" fi $series_opt \
deleted_lines: if [[ -z "$TAG_META" ]]; then echo ERROR: Missing meta lines in $VERSION tag message. exit 1 fi function get_tag_meta { typeset fieldname="$1" echo "$TAG_META" | grep "^meta:$fieldname:" | cut -f2 -d' ' } # The series name is part of the commit message left by release.sh. SERIES=$(get_tag_meta series) # The type of release this is. RELEASETYPE=$(get_tag_meta release-type) # The recipient for announcements is part of the commit message left # by release.sh. ANNOUNCE=$(get_tag_meta announce) if [[ ! -z "$ANNOUNCE" ]]; then email_to="--email-to $ANNOUNCE" fi # Figure out if that series is a stable branch or not. We don't # release pre-releases on stable branches, so we only need to check # for stable if the release type is a normal release. if [[ $RELEASETYPE = "release" ]]; then if git branch -a | grep -q origin/stable/$SERIES; then stable="--stable"fi # If this is the first full release in a series, it isn't "stable" # yet. FIRST_FULL=$(get_tag_meta first) if [[ $FIRST_FULL = "yes" ]]; then stable=""# Only include the PyPI link if we are told to. INCLUDE_PYPI_LINK=$(get_tag_meta pypi) if [[ "$INCLUDE_PYPI_LINK" == "yes" ]]; then include_pypi_link="--include-pypi-link" fi --series $SERIES \

commit_message:
Fix response code for rule creating API

This change introduces new return code (201 instead of 200) for
POST /v1/rules endpoint on success rule creation.

API less 1.6 continues returning 200.

Default API version was changed from minimum to maximum
which Inspector can support.

Change-Id: I911c7c241d16b9948ee4b6db92b127c7f8f374ae

commit_message:
image_size_m should get ceiling of image

In function fetch_to_volume_format when converting the
image size to Mb, image_meta['size'] is int and units.Mi
is int. In python2, image_meta['size'] / units.Mi get floor
int. So the image_size_m is less than the real image data.
This will cause copying image data is not complete. This
patch fixes it by getting the ceiling of image_size_m.

Change-Id: If7a7ea873e49ca1d071f3a2f080315f9f43cf059
Closes-Bug: #1591841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/329262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image_size_m = math.ceil(float(41126400) / units.Mi)

commit_message:
Add more details to the instructions for the Lego simulation

Explain a bit more what the objectives of each teams are, adding ideas
and few practical examples of how to conduct the game.

Change-Id: I784067821f151d2b823dac65dc991b73d7be584c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/19/330819/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: and unaffiliated individuals animated by unknown motives (free agents).fit their streets together to complete the session. Having more communities requires an extra level of coordination to reach `interoperability` between the results of their work. Give each person a nametag to wear, with their first name and their role written on it. For free agents, don't disclose who is distracted, controversial, or agreeable. The community will need to work this out on their own.a direction, and the team is on board. Their responsibility is to deliver value to their stakeholders. For upstream, have them think about the community standards they want to set: they are responsible for the quality of the finished product. For free agent contributors, use this time to get them to understand their role in the simulation: explain their part as agents of chaos. They can get straight to work as soon as they understand their role, no need to wait for the timer to go off. The free agents should not be forced to coordinate among themselves: there are better results if they find out how hard it is to accomplish anything without coordinating with others. In theory, the free agents can decide to demolish things, too: try suggesting this option to one of them, see what happens. Suggestions of projects to work on: simply will not accept. Make them understand that they are responsible for the finished product.making suggestions, without actually doing any of the work or giving answers. The role of the mentors is to ask questions to orient the conversations among the teams. For example, during the first sprint it is common that the CEO and the PTL will face incompatibility of their plans. Mentors should ask the teams how to address those issues. encourage one group to call for a meeting off the sprint cycle to sort the problem out.
deleted_lines: and individual free agents.fit their streets together (use the metaphor of an API for this) to complete the session. Give each person a nametag to wear, with their first name and their role written on it. For free agents, don't disclose who is distracted, controversial, or agreeable. The community will need to work this out on their own.a direction, and the team are on board. For upstream, have them think about the community standards they want to set. Free agent contributors can get straight to work during this phase. Suggestions: simply will not accept.making suggestions, without actually doing any of the work or giving answers.encourage one group to call a midcycle to sort the problem out.

commit_message:
Add console-log validator

We want to check if console-log is used as a publisher, it is the last
publisher defined. This is for zuulv25 specifically as we also use the
console-log publisher to upload our zuul-launcher logs.

Change-Id: I1c987158be13f90e382fcaec8c7d133ed595e177
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/88/329988/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(pabelanger): Make sure console-log is our last publisher # defined. We use the publisher to upload logs from zuul-launcher. result = _check_console_log_publisher(schema, entry) if result: count += result errors = True def _check_console_log_publisher(schema, entry): count = 0 if schema == JOB or schema == JOB_TEMPLATE: if 'publishers' in entry: if 'console-log' in entry['publishers'] and \ entry['publishers'][-1] != 'console-log': print "ERROR: The console-log publisher MUST be the last " \ "publisher in '%s':" % entry['name'] print entry['publishers'] count += 1 return count

Fix error jenkins scripts path.

We already move all slave_scripts to scripts directory

not found.

commit_message:
Add ACLs back for oslo.context

Gerrit's ACLs for oslo.context were still pointing at the oslo-incubator
ACLs which are now read only. Give oslo.context its own ACL file with
standard oslo permissions.

Change-Id: Ie6ad387d68dbf2cff3419eaa6b4de0f147ac9658

commit_message:
Remove check_i18n files

The translations are done via the pep8 checks. This code is no
longer needed and very out of date.

Change-Id: I702af0cabed2f4b665228ecf6ba0b6d67a343aa2
Closes-Bug: #1591902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-onos refs/changes/03/328903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # test-case for check_i18n.py # python check_i18n.py check_i18n.txt -d # message format checking # capital checking msg = _("hello world, error") msg = _("hello world_var, error") msg = _('file_list xyz, pass') msg = _("Hello world, pass") # format specifier checking msg = _("Hello %s world %d, error") msg = _("Hello %s world, pass") msg = _("Hello %(var1)s world %(var2)s, pass") # message has been localized # is_localized msg = _("Hello world, pass") msg = _("Hello world, pass") % var LOG.debug(_('Hello world, pass')) LOG.info(_('Hello world, pass')) raise x.y.Exception(_('Hello world, pass')) raise Exception(_('Hello world, pass')) # message need be localized # is_log_callfunc LOG.debug('hello world, error') LOG.debug('hello world, error' % xyz) sys.append('hello world, warn') # is_log_i18n_msg_with_mod LOG.debug(_('Hello world, error') % xyz) # default warn msg = 'hello world, warn' msg = 'hello world, warn' % var # message needn't be localized # skip only one word msg = '' msg = "hello,pass" # skip dict msg = {'hello world, pass': 1} # skip list msg = ["hello world, pass"] # skip subscript msg['hello world, pass'] # skip xml marker msg = "<test><t></t></test>, pass" # skip sql statement msg = "SELECT * FROM xyz WHERE hello=1, pass" msg = "select * from xyz, pass" # skip add statement msg = 'hello world' + e + 'world hello, pass' # skip doc string """ Hello world, pass """ class Msg: pass

commit_message:
Bump bandit linter to 1.0.1

The latest Bandit allows much better control of what test plugins
are run during a scan. Simple command line options allow a user to
filter plugins without having to edit a monster bandit.yaml config
file.

This is changed from the original patch after cherry picking. It
additionally updates the upper constraints for bandit to 1.0.1

Change-Id: Iccd81c17e84df03d249c1012277dad9cb68c5845
(cherry picked from commit 617cfd020a7ca6275da95578cd036afc1ae5e1ed)

commit_message:
Devstack plugin initialization while preparing the target devstack

In case of migrating a project from one supporting plugin to another,
say, neutron migrating from ml2/ovs to ovn plugin, the target devstack
will need additional services that will be started by the devstack
plugins.

Change-Id: I91ffc90c43f5d57f5cdcebe9d6bb60acc9736e40
Closes-bug: #1586342

added_lines: # Clone all devstack plugins on the new side, because we're not # running a full stack.sh fetch_plugins run_phase override_defaults run_phase source run_phase stack pre-install run_phase stack install run_phase stack post-config

commit_message:
MySQL check configuration

Create mysql.yaml only if configuration was passed via config
file (.my.cnf) or args.

Change-Id: I3346821e3cb50c5cdb4b1e4317b22411335fef44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/39/325239/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os process_exist = find_process_name('mysqld') is not None has_args_or_config_file = (self.args is not None or os.path.isfile(mysql_conf)) self.available = process_exist and has_args_or_config_file if not self.available: log.error(('MySQL configuration is not detected. ' 'Plugin for MySQL will not be configured.'))
deleted_lines: if find_process_name('mysqld') is not None: self.available = True

subject: Active Node Creation via adopt state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 15:38:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8d1f086c97d6b375cb036d156e677b1448391e82', 'message': 'WIP: Active Node Creation via adopt state

Change-Id: Ib3eadf4172e93add9a9855582f56cbb3707f3d39
Partial-Bug: #1526315
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-04 16:15:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/b185f82eef1d476a5b4474d734a1d3974942c110', 'message': 'Active Node Creation via adopt state

At present the ironic API explicitly sets the new state for
nodes to the beginning step in the ironic workflow.

As part of hardware fleet lifecycle management, an operator
expects to be able to migrate inventory and control systems
for their hardware fleet utilizing their existing inventory
data and allocation records. Ultimately this means that that
an imported host MAY already be allocated and unavailable
for immediate allocation.

As such, a mechanism is required to permit users to create
nodes in an ACTIVE state. This adds a new API provision_state
verb to allow users to move nodes from MANAGABLE state to
ACTIVE state.

Change-Id: Ib3eadf4172e93add9a9855582f56cbb3707f3d39
Partial-Bug: #1526315
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-29 19:13:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/2a5bb78474757c672d1df5ddbd1efecfbcfaa529', 'message': 'Active Node Creation via adopt state

At present the ironic API explicitly sets the new state for
nodes to the beginning step in the ironic workflow.

As part of hardware fleet lifecycle management, an operator
expects to be able to migrate inventory and control systems
for their hardware fleet utilizing their existing inventory
data and allocation records. Ultimately this means that
an imported host MAY already be allocated and unavailable
for immediate allocation.

As such, a mechanism is required to permit users to put nodes
into an ACTIVE state without performing a deployment operation.

At present the ironic API explicitly sets the new state for
nodes to the beginning step in the ironic workflow.

As part of hardware fleet lifecycle management, an operator
expects to be able to migrate inventory and control systems
for their hardware fleet utilizing their existing inventory
data and allocation records. Ultimately this means that
an imported host MAY already be allocated and unavailable
for immediate allocation.

As such, a mechanism is required to permit users to put nodes
into an ACTIVE state without performing a deployment operation.

This adds a new API provision_state verb to allow users to move
nodes from MANAGABLE state to ACTIVE state.

Additionally, an issue was identified with the iLO drivers where
use of this feature would cause the node to power-off.  Logic has
been updated to prevent and a bug has been filed for the larger
issue identified.

commit_message:
Active Node Creation via adopt state

At present the ironic API explicitly sets the new state for
nodes to the beginning step in the ironic workflow.

As part of hardware fleet lifecycle management, an operator
expects to be able to migrate inventory and control systems
for their hardware fleet utilizing their existing inventory
data and allocation records. Ultimately this means that
an imported host MAY already be allocated and unavailable
for immediate allocation.

As such, a mechanism is required to permit users to put nodes
into an ACTIVE state without performing a deployment operation.

This adds a new API provision_state verb to allow users to move
nodes from MANAGEABLE state to ACTIVE state.

Partial-Bug: #1526315
Change-Id: Ib3eadf4172e93add9a9855582f56cbb3707f3d39
Depends-On: Ie114bfaab249d73ea3ca7c0edc314ca1ed0448eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/66/275766/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ir_states.VERBS['adopt']: versions.MINOR_15_ADOPT_VERB, ir_states.VERBS['abort'], ir_states.VERBS['adopt'])

The Nova EC2 API is disabled by default, the default value
of the enabled_apis parameter in nova.conf is "osapi_compute, metadata"
The EC2 API is marked as deprecated and will be removed from Nova in
the future.

Change-Id: I6b9d66017e066cde5749be45b367194d2192ead3
Closes-bug: #1586605
'}]
commit_message:
Remove EC2 API related configurations and tasks

The Nova EC2 API is disabled by default, the default value
of the enabled_apis parameter in nova.conf is "osapi_compute, metadata"
The EC2 API is marked as deprecated and will be removed from Nova in
the future.

Change-Id: I6b9d66017e066cde5749be45b367194d2192ead3
Closes-bug: #1586605

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0

Change-Id: Ie52d0714a453652f0497d34fb758473755e7bc49

commit_message:
Correct concurrency of gabbi tests for gabbi 1.22.0

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

Change-Id: Ie52d0714a453652f0497d34fb758473755e7bc49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/91/330491/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: group_regex=gabbi\.(suitemaker|driver)\.(test_[^_]+_[^_]+)

The Mistral docker example does not work at the moment. The oslo.policy
library now requires the policy file to be set in the configuration.

Closes Bug: #1593286
Signed-off-by: Andras Kovi <akovi@nokia.com>

Change-Id: I7877f2a7acac5efca869e3f00b9e76cf8b3f5d66

commit_message:
Example Mistral docker container broke due to oslo.policy update

The Mistral docker example does not work at the moment. The oslo.policy
library now requires the policy file to be set in the configuration.

Closes Bug: #1593286
Signed-off-by: Andras Kovi <akovi@nokia.com>

Change-Id: I7877f2a7acac5efca869e3f00b9e76cf8b3f5d66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/48/330748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python -c " import ConfigParser c = ConfigParser.ConfigParser() c.read('/home/mistral/mistral.conf') c.set('database','connection','sqlite:////home/mistral/mistral.sqlite') c.set('DEFAULT', 'transport_url', 'rabbit://guest:guest@rabbitmq:5672/') c.set('oslo_policy', 'policy_file', '/opt/stack/mistral/etc/policy.json') c.set('pecan', 'auth_enable', 'false') with open('/home/mistral/mistral.conf', 'w') as f: c.write(f) "

raised exceptions don't use unlocalized string messages. This
patch also adds unit tests for the new check and enables

but it seems we already have a number of more generic checks
in neutron. We can discuss that here need be.

neutron-lib.

commit_message:
Localized exception message hacking check

As per [1], this patch adds a new hacking check that verifies
raised exceptions don't use unlocalized string messages. This
patch also adds unit tests for the new check and enables
checks for neutron-lib itself (as per tox.ini).

Note: Perhaps this check better belongs in openstack-dev/hacking
but it seems we already have a number of more generic checks
in neutron. We can discuss that here need be.

NB: Without [1] this new hacking check fails when running pep8 on
neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324374/

Change-Id: Ia13f190ec6843ab360d115871d345c4ddc302cc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/94/325494/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local-check-factory = neutron_lib.hacking.checks.factory

commit_message:
Add translation validations to the hacking policy

3 hacking rules have been migrated from neutron. The rules are:

 [N531] Validate that LOG messages, except debug ones,
        have translations
 [N532] Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of LOG.warn.
        The latter is deprecated.
 [N533] Validate that debug level logs are not translated

We need this to ensure that all projects using the neutron-lib
hacking rules still have enforcement of the log translation
policies of the project.

Change-Id: I3d3c6797805e59304e83b9d1bcbfc449080f823a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/65/325865/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [N531] Validate that LOG messages, except debug ones, have translations - [N532] Validate that LOG.warning is used instead of LOG.warn. The latter is deprecated. - [N533] Validate that debug level logs are not translated

commit_message:
Make the constant Sentinel() class public

This pattern can be useful so make it publicly available.

Change-Id: I8fab1a5804aecf17a00a908646b6a20869c4a03b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/98/327198/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Sentinel(object): """A constant object that does not change even when copied.""" def __deepcopy__(self, memo): # Always return the same object because this is essentially a constant. return self ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED = Sentinel()
deleted_lines: class _Sentinel(object): def __deepcopy__(self, memo): # always return the same object because this is essentially a constant return self ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED = _Sentinel()

commit_message:
Set device owner for health manager port

Devstack plugin creates the health manager port with no device owner.
This is unusual as this value usually has some meaningful value, and
although the port name is quite descriptive, a distro could use the
device owner value to lookup the health manager port.

Closes-bug: #1592007
Change-Id: I8f75c5f70837dbc2f66d3e34c52a39a25614ada3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/49/325649/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: id_and_mac=$(neutron port-create --name octavia-health-manager-listen-port --security-group lb-mgmt-sec-grp --device-owner octavia:health-mgr --binding:host_id=$(hostname) lb-mgmt-net | awk '/ id | mac_address / {print $4}')
deleted_lines: id_and_mac=$(neutron port-create --name octavia-health-manager-listen-port --security-group lb-mgmt-sec-grp --binding:host_id=$(hostname) lb-mgmt-net | awk '/ id | mac_address / {print $4}')

commit_message:
Implementation of baremetal power state commands

* baremetal node power on|off
* baremetal node reboot

Also, renamed baremetal.py to baremetal_node.py to match the command.

Change-Id: I79b75ecb5dd0b13e74f60f506ff37bda6178271c
Depends-On: Ia9fed8f4987cf8ae2ca0a3cb7726596a627cba4f
Partial-Bug: #1526479
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/17/172517/49 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class SetBaremetal(command.Command): """Set baremetal properties""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".CreateBaremetal") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(SetBaremetal, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'node', metavar='<node>', help="Name or UUID of the node.") parser.add_argument( '--power-state', metavar='<power-state>', choices=['on', 'off', 'reboot'], help="Set power state to: 'on', 'off', or 'reboot'.") return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take_action(%s)", parsed_args) baremetal_client = self.app.client_manager.baremetal if parsed_args.power_state is not None: baremetal_client.node.set_power_state( parsed_args.node, parsed_args.power_state) return

commit_message:
Add regex filter to group page graphs

This commit add regex filters to the group page graphs. The graph's
regex filter was introduced in the home page. However, we didn't care
about the group page at that time.

Change-Id: Id16e745ff3eff256be06829f65bd711041d20fe2
Closes-Bug: #1590059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/22/329322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 17:44:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ffe5f58fe7d130384299104fb57d4946b3b0b1b7', 'message': 'Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat

Our existing `refresh` method in CinderPersistentObject assumes that the
any persistent Versioned Object will also be a CinderObjectDictCompat
object, which is correct with all old OVOs but may not be correct in
newer OVOs.

This patch removes this assumption and accesses fields as object
attributes, both in the current OVO instance (self) and in the ORM
instance retrieved from the DB.

Change-Id: I88d0ae2379fb0db8844052125e241b01d82ef86d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 13:36:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e4ecd5ca7b1ffbdf90102bfb4a7b4747fdbe315b', 'message': 'Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat

Our existing `refresh` method in CinderPersistentObject assumes that the
any persistent Versioned Object will also be a CinderObjectDictCompat
object, which is correct with all old OVOs but may not be correct in
newer OVOs.

This patch removes this assumption and accesses fields as object
attributes, both in the current OVO instance (self) and in the ORM
instance retrieved from the DB.

Change-Id: I88d0ae2379fb0db8844052125e241b01d82ef86d
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-30 18:40:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8c5b498af509e0a549aaead8ecf535c614fc1ef7', 'message': 'Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat

Our existing `refresh` method in CinderPersistentObject assumes that the
any persistent Versioned Object will also be a CinderObjectDictCompat
object, which is correct with all old OVOs but may not be correct in
newer OVOs.

This patch removes this assumption and accesses fields as object
attributes, both in the current OVO instance (self) and in the ORM
instance retrieved from the DB.

Change-Id: I88d0ae2379fb0db8844052125e241b01d82ef86d
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-30 18:44:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6ecfffc6eaef19fcfc30c26e0b4beda3eba69861', 'message': 'Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat

Our existing `refresh` method in CinderPersistentObject assumes that the
any persistent Versioned Object will also be a CinderObjectDictCompat
object, which is correct with all old OVOs but may not be correct in
newer OVOs.

This patch removes this assumption and accesses fields as object

Change-Id: I88d0ae2379fb0db8844052125e241b01d82ef86d
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-31 11:58:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9c2eea18746bc68c1d5c1153840c643092290b93', 'message': 'Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat

Our existing `refresh` method in CinderPersistentObject assumes that the
any persistent Versioned Object will also be a CinderObjectDictCompat
object, which is correct with all old OVOs but may not be correct in
newer OVOs.

This patch removes this assumption and accesses fields as object
attributes, both in the current OVO instance (self) and in the ORM
instance retrieved from the DB.

commit_message:
Stop assuming persistent OVOs are also DictCompat

Our existing `refresh` method in CinderPersistentObject assumes that the
any persistent Versioned Object will also be a CinderObjectDictCompat
object, which is correct with all old OVOs but may not be correct in
newer OVOs.

This patch removes this assumption and accesses fields as object
attributes, both in the current OVO instance (self) and in the ORM
instance retrieved from the DB.

Change-Id: I88d0ae2379fb0db8844052125e241b01d82ef86d

commit_message:
Switches metering agent to stateless iptables

If state_less parameter is not specified then
neutron-postrouting-bottom rule goes up in POSTROUTING
chain, which causes premature NATing of traffic,
for ex. traffic between internal networks becomes NATed.

Closes-Bug: 1544508
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Belous <sbelous@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I2e0011237d50a59d417cfee01dcd5f9d0da2e7f5
(cherry picked from commit 5d2d1120fcdcd5977d3c760ac1520a841048d456)

We rename these to convert_block_device and convert_all_block_devices

commit_message:
Rename convert_volume and convert_all_volumes in virt.block_device

virt.block_device contains a function called convert_volumes which
converts only cinder volumes to DriverBlockDevice objects. It also
contains convert_volume and convert_all_volumes, which operate on all
block device types, not just cinder volumes. The latter is especially
confusing.

We rename these to convert_block_device and convert_all_block_devices
respectively, which is both descriptive and consistent with the
internal function _covert_block_devices.

Change-Id: Ib73c9b0ca0da426bf39738303fb8de1a4a5b9225
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/329381/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def convert_all_block_devices(*volume_bdms):def convert_block_device(volume_bdm): try: return convert_all_block_devices(volume_bdm)[0]
deleted_lines: def convert_all_volumes(*volume_bdms):def convert_volume(volume_bdm): try: return convert_all_volumes(volume_bdm)[0]

commit_message:
Define context.roles with base class

In f383bd2973c58c5272504603e4f9dddd55c5bb68, oslo.context (2.2.0)
added roles support in the context itself. This passes roles to
super()__init__.

commit_message:
Fix error for type-unset command

We cannot unset multi keys for a type because in
unset_keys() the value "resp" is a tuple with
response and body so that it cannot be None and
the loop always be interrupted. Instead, The "body"
will be None if a key be unsetted successfully,
So I think there is a mistake and I fixed it.

Change-Id: Ifb18c56d336aad259abe6bd599a618872d741169

commit_message:
manage_policyrcd: stop eventlet support from Newton

On Ubuntu Xenial, we're deploying Newton and UCA does not provide
keystone eventlet script anymore.

Change-Id: I33e565638f39ace819645215912303d6e431870c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/94/330694/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we don't have keystone service anymore starting from Newton if ($::operatingsystem == 'Ubuntu') and (versioncmp($::operatingsystemmajrelease, '16') >= 0) { class { '::openstacklib::policyrcd': services => ['apache2'] } } else { class { '::openstacklib::policyrcd': services => ['keystone', 'apache2'] } }

Author: Kevin Fox <kevin@efox.cc>
Date:   Tue May 31 17:00:20 2016 -0700

    Set some useful default values with the new launch wizard.

    In Mitaka, the new launch instance wizard regresses functionality
    from the old launch wizard with regards to defaults. If there is
    only one neutron network, it is not automatically selected, if
    there is only one keypair, its not selected, and the default
    security group is not automatically selected.

    This patch fixes all of that.

    Change-Id: I23bab6998e38ba1066b926a4fe71713768d9dff4
    Closes-Bug: #1587681
    (cherry picked from commit d4a8023d17f672f10e83e48fab4e97dc0796af76)

commit_message:
Improve new Launch Instance defaults + tests

commit 42a22cba55c6f9e43a9ed37f0487d9d765616641
Author: Rob Cresswell <robert.cresswell@outlook.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 3 10:32:07 2016 +0100

    Add missing unit tests to NG launch instance

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323623/ added a few new defaults to the
    Launch Instance but didn't add any tests, so the backport is blocked on
    coverage. Rather than lower coverage, we should just add the tests and
    squash the two commits in the backport.

    Fastest way to verify is to generate coverage in master, look at the
    lines added by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323623/ (red) then apply
    this patch and run again. You'll see they are all white.

    Change-Id: I07d2f5ebcb1771a548c0066699194ea619e7461c
    Related-Bug: #1587681
    (cherry picked from commit b3b88310e10d4315b6455f25a63d21e17100f57f)

commit 883552578acb30210dcd7533e8b6224551e5785f
Author: Kevin Fox <kevin@efox.cc>
Date:   Tue May 31 17:00:20 2016 -0700

    Set some useful default values with the new launch wizard.

    In Mitaka, the new launch instance wizard regresses functionality
    from the old launch wizard with regards to defaults. If there is
    only one neutron network, it is not automatically selected, if
    there is only one keypair, its not selected, and the default
    security group is not automatically selected.

    This patch fixes all of that.

    Change-Id: I23bab6998e38ba1066b926a4fe71713768d9dff4
    Closes-Bug: #1587681
    (cherry picked from commit d4a8023d17f672f10e83e48fab4e97dc0796af76)

Change-Id: I0f5c056db62915b4b50d4accba0b4645c88bffde

commit_message:
Clarify "data" arg in create/update_image()

The argument "data" is used for passing it as raw data to Glance API,
that is different from the other arguments.
This patch separates the argument on the definition and adds some
docstring for linking to api-site.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ifeeceeb71c18d658ae6d5a0393150be3470264b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/329218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Available params: http://developer.openstack.org/ api-ref-image-v1.html#createImage-v1 """ def update_image(self, image_id, data=None, **kwargs): """Update an image. Available params: http://developer.openstack.org/ api-ref-image-v1.html#updateImage-v1 """
deleted_lines: def create_image(self, **kwargs): data = kwargs.pop('data', None) def update_image(self, image_id, **kwargs): data = kwargs.pop('data', None)

commit_message:
Move get_image_meta_from_headers from images_client

Glance v1 images_client contains get_image_meta_from_headers() which
converts headers to returned body. However, most service clients'
methods don't convert like that.
Then this moves get_image_meta_from_headers() to common place like
the compute module from the service client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I40289be171239d45d81bdddcde55a1d68361a9f8

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. def get_image_meta_from_headers(resp): meta = {'properties': {}} for key in dir(resp): if key.startswith('x-image-meta-property-'): _key = key[22:] meta['properties'][_key] = getattr(resp, key) elif key.startswith('x-image-meta-'): _key = key[13:] meta[_key] = getattr(resp, key) for key in ['is_public', 'protected', 'deleted']: if key in meta: meta[key] = meta[key].strip().lower() in ('t', 'true', 'yes', '1') for key in ['size', 'min_ram', 'min_disk']: if key in meta: try: meta[key] = int(meta[key]) except ValueError: pass return meta

commit_message:
Use call_and_ignore_notfound_exc directly

This patch makes service client use call_and_ignore_notfound_exc
directly because the client only uses it.

Co-Authored-By: Ken'ichi Ohmichi <ken-oomichi@wx.jp.nec.com>
Closes-Bug: #1589521
Change-Id: I8ee81502a090aa0581e0b46b96bfa6144b456cc4

commit_message:
Oslo.utils safe_decode

Use safe_decode form encodeutils module. Depedency for oslo.utils
is right now >=3.5.0 and safe_decode method is in module
encodeutils. Without this change monascaclient shows error:
'module' object has no attribute 'safe_decode'.

Change-Id: I0f3d3400993c09eaa86c6ade346df46b4f93c65b

commit_message:
After a migration clean up the floating ip on the source host

When a VM is migrated that has a floating IP associated, the L3
agent on the source host should be notified when the migration
is over. If the router on the source host is not going to be
removed (there are other ports using it) then we should nofity
that the floating IP needs to be cleaned up.

Closes-bug: #1585165
(cherry picked from commit a1f06fd707ffe663e09f2675316257c8dc528d47)

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py
	neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py
Change-Id: Iad6fbad06cdd33380ef536e6360fd90375ed380d

commit_message:
Use callback to update SegmentHostMapping

agents_db is implicitly imported by neutron.db.models_v2.

This refactor delete the the import of neutron.services.segments.db,
which could avoid potential circle import.

Change-Id: I880bb07f407e2d95037b078c6fa91bccf537b99d
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

agent on the source host should be notified when the migration

commit_message:
Add rally plugin for cluster-size

This patch adds cluster-resize support in senlin rally
plugin as well as a test job for it. It also adds a
README file for rally-jobs of senlin.

Change-Id: I52e5461d44c6b4db16158a3993f75131ab31a1b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/79/328879/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @atomic.action_timer("senlin.resize_cluster") def _resize_cluster(self, cluster, adj_type=None, number=None, min_size=None, max_size=None, min_step=None, strict=True): """Adjust cluster size. :param identity: cluster dentity which can be name, id or short ID; :param adj_type: optional; if specified, must be one of the strings defined in consts.ADJUSTMENT_TYPES; :param number: number for adjustment. It is interpreted as the new desired_capacity of the cluster if `adj_type` is set to `EXACT_CAPACITY`; it is interpreted as the relative number of nodes to add/remove when `adj_type` is set to `CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY`; it is treated as a percentage when `adj_type` is set to `CHANGE_IN_PERCENTAGE`. This parameter is optional. :param min_size: new lower bound of the cluster size, if specified. This parameter is optional. :param max_size: new upper bound of the cluster size, if specified; A value of negative means no upper limit is imposed. This parameter is optional. :param min_step: optional. It specifies the number of nodes to be added or removed when `adj_type` is set to value `CHANGE_IN_PERCENTAGE` and the number calculated is less than 1 or so. :param strict: optional boolean value. It specifies whether Senlin should try a best-effort style resizing or just reject the request when scaling beyond its current size constraint. """ attrs = {} if adj_type: attrs['adjustment_type'] = adj_type if number: attrs['number'] = number if min_size: attrs['min_size'] = min_size if max_size: attrs['max_size'] = max_size if min_step: attrs['min_step'] = min_step attrs['strict'] = strict res = self.admin_clients("senlin").cluster_resize(cluster.id, **attrs) action = self._get_action(res['action']) utils.wait_for_status( action, ready_statuses=["SUCCEEDED"], failure_statuses=["FAILED"], update_resource=self._get_action, timeout=CONF.benchmark.senlin_action_timeout) self._delete_cluster(cluster) self._delete_profile(profile) @validation.required_openstack(admin=True) @validation.required_services(consts.Service.SENLIN) @scenario.configure(context={"cleanup": ["senlin"]}) def create_resize_delete_cluster(self, profile_spec, init_size, target_size, timeout=120): """Create a cluster, resize it and then delete it. Measure the "senlin cluster-create", "senlin cluster-resize" and "senlin cluster-delete" commands performance. :param profile_spec: the spec dictionary used to create profile :param init_size: the dictionary describe the initial size of cluster to create :param target_size: the dictionary describe the target size of cluster to resize :param timeout: The timeout value in minutes for each cluster action, including creation, deletion and resizing """ profile = self._create_profile(profile_spec) cluster = self._create_cluster(profile.id, timeout=timeout, **init_size) self._resize_cluster(cluster, **target_size) self._delete_cluster(cluster)

commit_message:
Remove the debian folder

Having the debian folder containing the packaging within the upstream
sources is a very bad idea, which everyone in Debian is trying to
discourage. This creates conflicts at many levels, plus the packaging
source should be kept and maintained in a single place (and in this
case, that would be Alioth, aka git.debian.org).

Since python-monascaclient has been uploaded to Debian (and therefore,
Ubuntu will sync from it), there's no need to carry the debian folder
here. So this patch removes it.

Note that I have just uploaded version 1.0.30+dfsg1-2 to Debian. The
"+dfsg1" part shows I had to re-create an orig.tar.xz without the
debian folder.

Change-Id: I97ad99e017132e8929f037fd97a2071e14aa3726

commit_message:
Deprecate the functions map after segment moving out of ml2

This is a clean up for patch [1], the functions map should be removed
to make code easy to read. Start a deprecation cycle for these functions
in case external projects will use them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242393

Change-Id: I77c83bd7ee0c8ef92d8aaaa8e968479b848532fe
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Fix incorrect message when getting non-existing claim

When getting non-existing claim after it has expired,
the retruning message is not correct, it looks like
this now:

"Claim {queue_name} does not exist in queue {project_id} for project
{claim_id}".

It caused by error order args when init the ClaimDoesNotExist exception.

Change-Id: I995d7b6b510b6ddd830d4d0c00a6ba61df5adb81
Closes-Bug: #1591843
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/26/328826/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise errors.ClaimDoesNotExist(claim_id, queue, project)

subject: SolidFire driver should return ceiling of volume size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 01:24:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/f14aace2c21d6605e12150c54cdb1fd714c112ad', 'message': 'SolidFire driver should return ceiling of volume size

The function manage_existing_get_size returns the floor of volume size
in solidfire driver. But in the driver API:"When calculating the size,
round up to the next GB." The solidFire driver should be consistent
with the driver API. This patch fixes it by returning the ceiling of
volume size.

Change-Id: Icc4f893b9e18dc525b85b45f3307663b6d8884ed
Closes-Bug: #1586306
'}]
commit_message:
SolidFire driver should return ceiling of volume size

The function manage_existing_get_size returns the floor of volume size
in solidfire driver. But in the driver API:"When calculating the size,
round up to the next GB." The solidFire driver should be consistent
with the driver API. This patch fixes it by returning the ceiling of
volume size.

Change-Id: Icc4f893b9e18dc525b85b45f3307663b6d8884ed
Closes-Bug: #1586306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/326776/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'totalSize': int(1.75 * units.Gi), def test_manage_existing_get_size(self): external_ref = {'name': 'existing volume', 'source-id': 5} testvol = {'project_id': 'testprjid', 'name': 'testvol', 'size': 1, 'id': 'a720b3c0-d1f0-11e1-9b23-0800200c9a66', 'created_at': timeutils.utcnow()} mock_issue_api_request = self.mock_object(solidfire.SolidFireDriver, '_issue_api_request') mock_issue_api_request.side_effect = self.fake_issue_api_request sfv = solidfire.SolidFireDriver(configuration=self.configuration) size = sfv.manage_existing_get_size(testvol, external_ref) self.assertEqual(2, size)

commit_message:
Moving feroda atomic image to the bay driver folder.

Moving the fedora atomic image to the new driver folder.
This is a common image used by swarm and kubernetes,
and has been moved to a common folder.

Change-Id: I98051da7e9c8f7943fb5fe2109989d66b4b03736
Partially-Implements: blueprint bay-drivers

commit_message:
Ensure console-log is our last publisher

This is related to zuulv25, we make sure console-log is the last
publisher to ensure zuul-launcher logs are also uploaded.

Change-Id: I1616b97fad2b97fb9e977ec14543aab4bc673b58
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

In the Tricircle, the networking is established before the physical server is
plugged into. The simplest way to stretch one L2 network across multiple
OpenStack instances is to use a same VLAN network, but there is a lot of limitation: the number of VLAN segment is limited, the VLAN network itself is not good to spread across multiple sites, although you can use some gateways to do so.
So flexible tenant level L2 networking across multiple OpenStack instances in
one site or in multiple sites is needed.

This spec deal with the cross OpenStack L2 networking automation
in Tricircle.

Change-Id: I616048c13d03f48aa16d9ff48572b0d5a49d6fb4

'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2016-05-14 10:48:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/3d9f8469aaf229397d54eae34a3b70db095feeb3', 'message': 'Add cross-pod L2 Networking spec file

In the Tricircle, the cross pod (OpenStack) L2 networking automation is
established after the virtual machine is plugged into. The simplest way
to stretch one L2 network across multiple OpenStack instances is to use
a same VLAN network, but there is a lot of limitation: the number of VLAN
segment is limited, the VLAN network itself is not good to spread across
multiple sites, although you can use some gateways to do so. But there
are so many tenants in the cloud, and new tenants could be added into
the cloud dynamically, fixed physical network configuration for dynamic
tenant networking is hard to manage, so flexible tenant level L2
networking automation across multiple OpenStack instances in one site or
in multiple sites is needed.

This spec deal with how the networking automation can supports more than
one bottom pods in AZ or multiple AZs in Tricircle.

Change-Id: I616048c13d03f48aa16d9ff48572b0d5a49d6fb4
'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-05-16 12:45:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/5518e229373f4365e620b9feed7ebb5d075f1ace', 'message': 'Add cross-pod L2 Networking spec file

multiple sites, although you can use some gateways to do so. But there
are so many tenants in the cloud, and new tenants could be added into
the cloud dynamically, fixed physical network configuration for dynamic
tenant networking is hard to manage, so flexible tenant level L2

This spec deal with how the networking automation can supports more than

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/cross-site-connectivity

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2016-05-24 13:45:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/cdd060b5fbd713f5e622be36d3b34775e3fa2d94', 'message': 'Add cross-pod L2 Networking spec file

In the Tricircle, the cross pod (OpenStack) L2 networking automation is
established after the virtual machine is plugged into. The simplest way
to stretch one L2 network across multiple OpenStack instances is to use
a same VLAN network, but there is a lot of limitation: the number of VLAN
segment is limited, the VLAN network itself is not good to spread across
multiple sites, although you can use some gateways to do so. But there
are so many tenants in the cloud, and new tenants could be added into
the cloud dynamically, fixed physical network configuration for dynamic
tenant networking is hard to manage, so flexible tenant level L2
networking automation across multiple OpenStack instances in one site or
in multiple sites is needed.

This spec deal with how the networking automation can supports more than
one bottom pods in AZ or multiple AZs in Tricircle.

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/cross-site-connectivity
Change-Id: I616048c13d03f48aa16d9ff48572b0d5a49d6fb4
