commit_message:
Yield the thread when verifying image's signature

We should give other threads chance to run when verifying image's
signature. For more details, please refer to:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/threading.html# \
yielding-the-thread-in-long-running-tasks

Closes-Bug: #1591234
Change-Id: Id5974b925dbfab7b66b6432abbc92990dea39112

commit_message:
Add kolla-kubernetes bootstrap capability to Keystone

Kolla-kubernetes requires there be an alternative way to bootstrap
the container. Kolla-kubernetes needs to signal the Kubernetes API
endpoint to make the cluster aware a bootstrap is in progress.

Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-extended-dockerfiles
Change-Id: Ie078017496eec81188d4c7c7916a70d1722f8aee

commit_message:
Add kolla-kubernetes bootstrap capability to mariadb

Kolla-kubernetes requires there be an alternative way to bootstrap
the container.  Kolla-kubernetes uses the Kubernetes API endpoint to
read information about the cluster so that the bootstrap process runs
serially.

Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-extended-dockerfiles
Change-Id: I6185f2522b1151c934871a1ad2387f0001c0a320
Co-authored-by: Ken Wronkiewicz <wh-openstack@wirewd.com>

commit_message:
Fix subscription limit per queue

Query for all subscriptions on a given queue by taking into account the
returned marker, if any.

Change-Id: I6b03dd93cabc76d1c91041a896fbb30ac08032f1
Closes-Bug: #1590173

subject: DevStack: Configure port setup delay for IPMI + Virtual
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-09 10:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/04a9b5ffd0fdbb269920d318ea602c48c2d21fdd', 'message': 'DevStack: Configure port setup delay for IPMI + Virtual

This patch is setting the [neutron] port_setup_delay configuration
option to 15 (seconds) for virtual environments using the ipmitool
driver (e.g VirtualBMC). This is due a potential race condition between
the neutron ports getting updated with the new DHCP options and the
ironic node booting too quickly (likely to happen on virtual
environments).

Change-Id: I95017f7a9e9d85342e173bbd7a6c230952545cdc
Related-Bug: #1334447
'}]
commit_message:
DevStack: Configure port setup delay for IPMI + Virtual

This patch is setting the [neutron] port_setup_delay configuration
option to 15 (seconds) for virtual environments using the ipmitool
driver (e.g VirtualBMC). This is due a potential race condition between
the neutron ports getting updated with the new DHCP options and the
ironic node booting too quickly (likely to happen on virtual
environments).

Change-Id: I95017f7a9e9d85342e173bbd7a6c230952545cdc
Related-Bug: #1334447
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/89/327589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_deployed_by_ipmitool && [[ "$IRONIC_IS_HARDWARE" == "False" ]]; then # NOTE(lucasagomes): When ipmitool is used with a virtual # environment (e.g VirtualBMC) we need to add a delay to make # sure Neutron have applied the DHCP configuration before booting # the virtual machine. For more details see: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1334447 iniset $IRONIC_CONF_FILE neutron port_setup_delay 15 fi

commit_message:
Correct some misspell words in nova

There are some misspell words in nova,
    availabilty (availability)
    Synchronise (Synchronize)
    evacaute (evacuate)
    leagacy (legacy)
    doen't (doesn't)
    Assocate (Associate)

Change-Id: I9a5e85278c94ba830d94ac15e0b7b8e3efc8e4d8
Closes-Bug: #1579997

commit_message:
Add timeout argument to some test methods

In some methods of UITestCase in functional tests base, the
timeout of ui.WebDriverWait was hardcoded, and it was impossible
to call them with some other (bigger) timeout if it's needed for
some test cases.
This patch adds ability to call them with custom timeout.

Change-Id: I5ec9b3a1a61d92b2ea7744d58504ce299bec1d6a
Closes-bug: #1591107

subject: Rally could not identify keyword 'volume-type'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 09:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/cinder/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/d8eda9602e52139ca0f9a9283005cb6f7ebae433', 'message': 'Rally could not identify keyword 'volume-type'

The cli command to create a volume with specified type in openstack is:
cinder create --volume-type lvm1 10
But if we use keyword "volume-type" in rally json file, error will be
raise becasue the keyword can be identified is "volume_type". This patch
fixs it by making key "volume-type" usable.

Change-Id: Ib37cd486c242b6641e399a900cbeedf2ea534894
Closes-bug: #1593154
'}]
commit_message:
Rally could not identify keyword 'volume-type'

The cli command to create a volume with specified type in openstack is:
cinder create --volume-type lvm1 10
But if we use keyword "volume-type" in rally json file, error will be
raise becasue the keyword can be identified is "volume_type". This patch
fixs it by making key "volume-type" usable.

Change-Id: Ib37cd486c242b6641e399a900cbeedf2ea534894
Closes-bug: #1593154
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/00/330400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if kwargs.get("volume-type"): kwargs["volume_type"] = kwargs.pop("volume-type")

commit_message:
Support bulk deletion for commands that exist in both network and compute.

Some delete commands in networkv2 are exist in both network
and compute, They can use NetworkAndComputeDeleteclass to
supprot bulk deletion and error handling and the codes are
similar, so I change them all in this patch. The changed
commands including:
1.floating ip delete
2.security group delete
3.security group rule delete
Also, I update unit tests and docs for these commands in this patch.

Change-Id: I6c94c3d10ba579ddd9b14d17673c821e3481fd8a
Partially-Implements: blueprint multi-argument-network

commit_message:
Adds nested blocks to skip steps if there are no overcloud VMs

In place of adding 'ignore_errors' lines to avoid having the
playbook bail out of there are no overcloud VMs defined
(as in the baremetal case), this commit adds a nested block
to skip overcloud teardown if no such overcloud nodes
are defined.

Change-Id: Id2d5ee40d95838788ec678b4b367711aabd4d420
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/17/329617/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ignore_errors: true

commit_message:
use environmental variables for ansible ssh configuration

quickstart does not set the ansible ssh configuration by default.
This change sets ANSIBLE_SSH_ARGS if it's not already set.

Change-Id: I61d8499fe16eb102a285972d347cef5acdbc71e8

commit_message:
Add retries for keystone-manage tasks

keystone-manage db_sync fails permanently without any
chance to recover via additional puppet runs if it cannot
complete successfully on the first run. Adding retries
reduces the likelihood that deployment fails.

Change-Id: Ie6c31d7c1d0f8be331c5cc878328eea630e57e0c
Closes-Bug: #1592819
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/25/330025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(mattymo): Move retries to puppet-keystone Exec<| tag == 'keystone-exec' |> { tries => '10', try_sleep => '5', }

subject: Register core_plugin for all tests in test_plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 07:14:09.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/59ad16c78bf0fa8e0550cadc8c9b59664ec64034', 'message': 'Register core_plugin for all tests in test_plugin

1. What is the problem
In test_plugin module, we define a stub class FakePlugin to
bypass real database access for unit tests. In some previous
test cases, FakePlugin object is directly created and then
we test its function, but after some changes in Neutron, we
also need to register the class path of FakePlugin to an
configuration option called core_plugin, otherwise some of
test cases will fail with "core_plugin not configured" error.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Register core_plugin for each test cases.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Register core_plugin in setUp function then every test cases
can use this option.

Change-Id: Ibc2d81585ec8e67c3f56f864c4cbc5d2f0a0efa9
'}]
commit_message:
Register core_plugin for all tests in test_plugin

1. What is the problem
In test_plugin module, we define a stub class FakePlugin to
bypass real database access for unit tests. In some previous
test cases, FakePlugin object is directly created and then
we test its function, but after some changes in Neutron, we
also need to register the class path of FakePlugin to an
configuration option called core_plugin, otherwise some of
test cases will fail with "core_plugin not configured" error.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Register core_plugin for each test cases.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
Register core_plugin in setUp function then every test cases
can use this option.

Change-Id: Ibc2d81585ec8e67c3f56f864c4cbc5d2f0a0efa9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/47/330347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Currently, unit testcases of virt emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so

Currently, unit testcases of virt emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

Fake constants are defined for project_id and user_id as they
are used without '-' at keystone side.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings in virt testcases

Currently, unit testcases of virt emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

Fake constants are defined for project_id and user_id as they
are used without '-' at keystone side.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Partial-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: If69412eddb5e64cb8ccc5dce9176d19382c0b3f1

commit_message:
Add helpers to NetworkRequest(List) objects for auto/none cases

This adds enums for the special 'auto' and 'none'
cases for the NetworkRequest.network_id along with some
helper properties so we don't have to hard-code the
checks all over the compute and network APIs.

Part of blueprint get-me-a-network

Change-Id: I85a6943d88aa08cfebd53a17e37cdca82011e98d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/297871/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # These are special case enums for the auto-allocate scenario. 'none' means # do not allocate a network on server create. 'auto' means auto-allocate a # network (if possible) if none are already available to the project. Other # values for network_id can be a specific network id, or None, where None # is the case before auto-allocation was supported in the compute API. NETWORK_ID_NONE = 'none' NETWORK_ID_AUTO = 'auto' @property def is_auto_allocate(self): return self.network_id == NETWORK_ID_AUTO @property def is_no_allocate(self): return self.network_id == NETWORK_ID_NONE @property def is_auto_allocate(self): return len(self.objects) == 1 and self.objects[0].is_auto_allocate @property def is_no_allocate(self): return len(self.objects) == 1 and self.objects[0].is_no_allocate

commit_message:
Improve the help text for cells options (7)

Some comments on `Improve the help text for cells options`
reviews are implemented with this patch.

- nova.cells.opts:list_ops function removed.

Implements blueprint centralize-config-options-newton
Change-Id: Idcaf66f0db1695d4fff34a656df2934c1b6d2ede

commit_message:
Handle SetAdminPasswdNotSupported raised by libvirt driver

When admin-password operation is not supported by libvirt qemu/kvm
SetAdminPasswdNotSupported exception is raised, compute manager doesn't
handle it, which cause instance state to be set to error.

Closes-bug: #1522338

Change-Id: Ic63e8f723ff19dfa63199e77ea76680bff5a123b

commit_message:
Ignore aodh_endpoint argument

When using keystone session, we seem to pass all **kwargs to
SessionClient for metering. We should drop the 'aodh_endpoint'
from kwargs.

Change-Id: Iaf28d4a525d49f62a0ae635dc1102cc1f0308c74
Closes-Bug: #1589425

commit_message:
Add pip_get_pip_options to fall back Install PIP

We need to apply pip_get_pip_options to the fall back pip
installation so that arguments like --cert will be passed
during pip installation.

Change-Id: I5f8d2e19596d71987f03c4cf9c131e48a4bdb486

commit_message:
Separate restoring of logs into LogsArchivator

The part that is responsible for restoring of logging files of nodes
was separated from NailgunArchivator into a separate archivator that was
called LogsArchivator.

commit_message:
Separate restoring of release in ReleaseArchivator

The part that is responsible for restoring of an appropriate release
was separated from NailgunArchivator into ReleaseArchivator.

Also _post_restore_actions was decomposed on two separate functions:
  - _repair_database_consistency
  - _create_links_on_remote_logs

Change-Id: I4a91fe8db962f45f8b2050e4772d2aafaf2060ff

'}]
commit_message:
Only match full IP addresses in /etc/hosts

Include the space in after the IP address in the match string to avoid
matching IP addreses which only differ in an addtional digit at the end.
With the previous logic an entry for 10.1.1.1 would also delete entries
for 10.1.1.12 or 10.1.1.123.

Change-Id: I797ff261630f4115b3852138c19eb039303e27c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/45/329945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i '/^{{ hostvars[item]["ansible_ssh_host"] }} .*/d' /etc/hosts

commit_message:
Fix openstack cluster resize

User should be allowed to resize cluster without
changing its size. This patch removes incorrect
constraint defined in openstack cluster resize
implementation.

Change-Id: I7592f76d23a583bcc696a86dc75ada41be6b0f9d

commit_message:
Prepare adapt for aodh stuff for library

Upstream aodh commit [1] introduce new parameters and parameter
sections and as a result it can break library. Hence we need to
adapt our code to new upstream changes.

All comments will be removed after upstream patch will be merged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/328806

Closes-bug: #1592370

Change-Id: I78b0abf0b472fd65cae7ffb78a0bd58ab7e6f822

commit_message:
Update for radosgw-keystone

* Remove generating PKI from keystone
* Turn off pki usage in radosgw
* Set rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone to false
* Remove needless rgw_keystone_revocation_interval

Change-Id: Ieb8797510f51dbdd4eaeefb614f37888ae89706d
Closes-Bug: 1592025

commit_message:
Trivial comments fix

Now the deploy_utils.validate_capabilities will not only
check boot_mode and boot_option capabilities but also
check the disk_label value for the iSCSI deploy interface.

Change-Id: Ia14f49301f97986e3aaece6b50cfbedd3f461e72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/70/329870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """iSCSI Deploy Interface for deploy-related actions.""" # Check the boot_mode, boot_option and disk_label capabilities values.
deleted_lines: """PXE Deploy Interface for deploy-related actions.""" # Check the boot_mode and boot_option capabilities values.

subject: Replaces pre-built javascript
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 15:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['docs/_templates/bootstrap/static/jquery.js', 'docs/_templates/bootstrap/static/bootstrap.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/9b2f69ac9c306045c958b3900bc9bcc31ddfc6e9', 'message': 'Replaces pre-built javascript

fuel-web contains pre-built (aka: minified) javascript in its doc folder,
which makes the whole git repository as non-free, and not uploadable in
downstream distribution. This patch replaces both bootstrap.js and
jquery.js by their non-minified equivalent.

Change-Id: I618b1b9826409ddd267347744931ef48a5b27411
Closes-Bug: #1544486
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces pre-built javascript

fuel-web contains pre-built (aka: minified) javascript in its doc folder,
which makes the whole git repository as non-free, and not uploadable in
downstream distribution. This patch replaces both bootstrap.js and
jquery.js by their non-minified equivalent.

Change-Id: I618b1b9826409ddd267347744931ef48a5b27411
Closes-Bug: #1544486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/31/293531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move TestAuth unscoped token tests to TokenAPITests

In test_v3_auth.py, we have a couple different classes that test similar token
API behaviors. The TestAuth class is only inherited and tested by the fernet
provider where the TokenAPITests class tested with the uuid, fernet, and pki
providers. This patch is one of many that will migrate duplicate tests from
TestAuth to TokenAPITests.

Change-Id: Ia2d7f857d078dde8486df6108009c76e50f353e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/89/329589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_unscoped_token_with_user_id(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.user['id'], password=self.user['password']) r = self.v3_create_token(auth_data) self.assertValidUnscopedTokenResponse(r) def test_create_unscoped_token_with_user_domain_id(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( username=self.user['name'], user_domain_id=self.domain['id'], password=self.user['password']) r = self.v3_create_token(auth_data) self.assertValidUnscopedTokenResponse(r) def test_create_unscoped_token_with_user_domain_name(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( username=self.user['name'], user_domain_name=self.domain['name'], password=self.user['password']) r = self.v3_create_token(auth_data) self.assertValidUnscopedTokenResponse(r)
deleted_lines: def test_unscoped_token_with_user_id(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.user['id'], password=self.user['password']) r = self.v3_create_token(auth_data) self.assertValidUnscopedTokenResponse(r) def test_unscoped_token_with_user_domain_id(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( username=self.user['name'], user_domain_id=self.domain['id'], password=self.user['password']) r = self.v3_create_token(auth_data) self.assertValidUnscopedTokenResponse(r) def test_unscoped_token_with_user_domain_name(self): auth_data = self.build_authentication_request( username=self.user['name'], user_domain_name=self.domain['name'], password=self.user['password']) r = self.v3_create_token(auth_data) self.assertValidUnscopedTokenResponse(r)

commit_message:
Introspect logging testing more

This adds some fixtures to ensure the log output is what we expect,
along with ensuring we test the operation of the debug environment
variables.

Change-Id: I01c36299539b15a633b9307da5a348a5ae4e2563
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/71/328071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import fixtures self.out = self.useFixture(fixtures.StringStream('stdout')) self.useFixture( fixtures.MonkeyPatch('sys.stdout', self.out.stream)) self.err = self.useFixture(fixtures.StringStream('stderr')) self.useFixture( fixtures.MonkeyPatch('sys.stderr', self.err.stream)) self.useFixture(fixtures.EnvironmentVariable('DIB_DEBUG_TRACE', '1')) self.assertIn("Debug Message", self.err._details["stderr"].as_text()) self.assertIn("Info Message", self.err._details["stderr"].as_text()) self.assertIn("Warning Message", self.err._details["stderr"].as_text()) self.assertIn("Error Message", self.err._details["stderr"].as_text())

commit_message:
Add python logger configuration

This adds a common usable logging configuration for DIB, that
can be used by different python tools or elements.

This change is a factored out patch from the block device
refactoring.

Change-Id: I34d44610f74030936e7c0f602340b183baec3f1b
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/09/325409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Andreas Florath (andreas@florath.net) # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # Python Logging Configuration for DIB # Usage: # In the main (application) file, do an # import logging_config # It is then possible to use the normal python logging interface, like # logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) # logger.info("Info Message") import json import logging import logging.config import os # Check for the DIB_DEBUG_TRACE environment variable # If it is set to something greater then 0, use debug # logging. LOG_LEVEL = "DEBUG" if 'DIB_DEBUG_TRACE' in os.environ \ and int(os.environ['DIB_DEBUG_TRACE']) > 0 else "INFO" # Default logging configuration which can be overwritten # by a config file passed in by a user. PYTHON_LOGGING_CONFIG = { 'version': 1, 'disable_existing_loggers': False, 'formatters': { 'standard': { 'format': '%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d;%(name)s;%(process)s;' '%(filename)s;%(funcName)s;%(lineno)s;%(levelname)s;' '%(message)s', 'datefmt': '%Y-%m-%d,%H:%M:%S' } }, 'handlers': { 'default': { 'level': LOG_LEVEL, 'class': 'logging.StreamHandler', 'formatter': 'standard' }, }, 'loggers': { '': { 'handlers': ['default'], 'level': LOG_LEVEL, 'propagate': True } } } if 'DIB_PYTHON_LOGGING_CONFIG_FILE' in os.environ: with open(os.environ['DIB_PYTHON_LOGGING_CONFIG_FILE']) as fd: PYTHON_LOGGING_CONFIG = json.load(fd) logging.config.dictConfig(PYTHON_LOGGING_CONFIG)

subject: Remove the AIO metadata checksum fix from run-playbooks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 17:57:38.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/1133ea8de25517321068ec77980f264fdce1d073', 'message': 'Remove the AIO metadata checksum fix from run-playbooks

it should be safe to remove the AIO metadata checksum fix from
run-playbooks.

This patch implements the appropriate AIO configuration to ensure that
the fix is still implemented by the os_neutron role, and also implements
a convenience fix for repeated runs of run-playbooks (mostly as a proof
of concept right now).

The intent is still to wholly replace run-playbooks with the standard
production execution of the three high-level playbooks. This will be

commit_message:
Remove the AIO metadata checksum fix from run-playbooks

With the implementation of I008bfdb2960800845703e721b38640b7434d1404
it should be safe to remove the AIO metadata checksum fix from
run-playbooks.

This patch implements the appropriate AIO configuration to ensure that
the fix is still implemented by the os_neutron role, and also implements
a convenience fix for repeated runs of run-playbooks (mostly as a proof
of concept right now).

The intent is still to wholly replace run-playbooks with the standard
production execution of the three high-level playbooks. This will be
implemented in a follow-on patch.

Change-Id: If75911c2aafa691e147f3b444d922f1dfcf87860
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/62/327262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not use database ids in bridge and interface names

- added Driver.get_available_device_name to help
  generate a valid names for libvirt networks and
  node interfaces.
- check existing devices using libvirt.
- removed settings LIBVIRT_BR_PREFIX, LIBVIRT_IF_PREFIX

Change-Id: If69e0aa7ffc5d673014fdce8485883afa111d44b
Implements: blueprint fuel-devops-multiple-databases

commit_message:
Update ml2 delete_subnet to deallocate via ipam

Previosly during delete_subnet in ml2 plugin ip allocation were removed
directly from database. This way ipam driver was unaware of this
deallocation.

Updated workflow to skip removing ip allocations directly from database.
Now ips are deallocated during update_port workflow (L1008).

This resolves issue with dhcp ports left in allocated state on ipam
provides side. Now they are correctly deallocated via update_port.

But this patch has next limitation: currently SLAAC allocations can
not be delete via update_port workflow, so ipam driver is still unaware
of such deallocations.
This part of issue is expected to be fixed as separate patch.

Subnet_in_use check was reworked. Previously it assumed that
auto-allocated ip are already deleted by the time of this check, but
with new workflow auto allocated ips are deleted later (on update_port).
So now this check verifies if there are any user allocated ips instead
of checking all allocations.

Partial-Bug: #1564335
Change-Id: I08d66da8cb57ed88e11ec2b18c8345edfce37d37

added_lines: # Check if there are any user IP allocations, unless user_alloc = self._subnet_get_user_allocation( context, id) if user_alloc: LOG.info(_LI("Found port (%(port_id)s, %(ip)s) " "having IP allocation on subnet " "%(subnet)s, cannot delete"), {'ip': user_alloc.ip_address, 'port_id': user_alloc.port_id, 'subnet': id}) raise exc.SubnetInUse(subnet_id=id)

attribute strategy_id.

commit_message:
[install] remove Debian specific procedure from tool

As of now, we don't have Debian Install Guide for Mitaka,
but we need this backport not to break the build tool chains.

This is a following patch of I8df6b3b382137d08d60f85bc41bcd98ac1f4eb47
"Factor out Install Guide for Debian with debconf".
Mainly, remove Debian specific procedure from build tool.
Also, remove debconf content from Debian Install Guide,
but there are still some debconf content, which is needed to
cleanup at further following patches.

Change-Id: Iffced3907ac2fddd42e6adc56b6e4859fde8e987

commit_message:
Allow bulleted lists in config reference

This is very much a hack, but its really just to see if it is possible
to convert the bullet lists into text that renders correctly with rst.

This was tested with the nova-hyperv.rst:
https://github.com/JohnGarbutt/openstack-manuals/blob/f0607509e349ba83074f163fe5c2f813dfc673a4/doc/config-reference/source/tables/nova-hyperv.rst

Change-Id: Iab063774f6732d52cd8e79f82ff0fc93bd6d306b

commit_message:
Update README

Update README to:
* take into account the fact that bagpipe-bgp is installed as a submodule
* indicate that 'enable_service b-bgp' is needed

Change-Id: I1e02bcbdbbdba0fb20878224b8ed7ebf3c1ca602
Suggested-By: Cdric Ollivier <ollivier.cedric@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/97/329897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * configure bagpipe-bgp_ on each compute node * (note that with devstack, bagpipe-bgp_ is installed automatically as a git submodule of networking-bagpipe) * the following is needed in `local.conf` to configure bagpipe-bgp_ and start it in devstack:: enable_service b-bgp * you also need each bagpipe_bgp_ to peer with a BGP Route Reflector: * in `local.conf`:: * for two compute nodes, you can use the FakeRR provided in bagpipe-bgp_ * for more than two compute nodes, you can use GoBGP_ (`sample configuration`_) or a commercial E-VPN implementation (e.g. vendors participating in `EANTC interop testing on E-VPN <http://www.eantc.de/fileadmin/eantc/downloads/events/2011-2015/MPLSSDN2015/EANTC-MPLSSDN2015-WhitePaper_online.pdf>`_)
deleted_lines: * install and configure bagpipe-bgp_ on each compute node, with a peering to at least one common BGP Route Reflector: * enable the devstack plugin for bagpipe-bgp by adding this to `local.conf`: :: enable_plugin bagpipe-bgp https://github.com/Orange-OpenSource/bagpipe-bgp.git * for two compute nodes, you can use the FakeRR provided in bagpipe-bgp_ * for more than two compute nodes, you can use GoBGP_ (`sample configuration`_) or a commercial E-VPN implementation (e.g. vendors participating in `EANTC interop testing on E-VPN <http://www.eantc.de/fileadmin/eantc/downloads/events/2011-2015/MPLSSDN2015/EANTC-MPLSSDN2015-WhitePaper_online.pdf>`_)

commit_message:
Make service plugins' get_plugin_type classmethods

Any service plugin that implements the get_plugin_type method should
make it a classmethod.  It should not need to be instantiated to
retrieve the simple constant it returns in every case.

Change-Id: Ia3a1237a5e07169ebc9378b1cd4188085e20d71c
Closes-Bug: #1590117

commit_message:
Updated two projects in gerrit/projects.yaml

For 'openstack/fuel-plugin-murano-networking-sfc'
and 'openstack/fuel-plugin-networking-sfc' there is a
update in gerrit/projects.yaml, to use its default
value for 'group' and 'docimpact-group' as these
projects exists on launchpad, and the 'fuel-plugins'
should not be used.

Change-Id: I9cdfff53faaae9250a792454fd8afd1197e125d3

commit_message:
Add logging to hostname_equals_servername function

One of compute api server tests  'test_host_name_is_same_as_server_name'
has been failing with error message 'false is not equal to true'. Turning
on debug and verbose doesnt reveal much info how are expected and actual
values different. This commit intends to add logging so when in debugging
mode, we know the values being compared in this test.

Change-Id: I808ea784d6018b6aa320df652455cb88f777ddfd

commit_message:
Shorten the name of the kolla-kubernetes gates

I left out kubernetes in the gate namei initially.  Adding it
in makes the gate name quite long.  This will shorten it a little.

Also dropped the Ubuntu binary gate for now.  Kolla-kubernetes
doesn't need it just yet.

Change-Id: Ic2525861e0423f115a449c7f7a0704b42ec1fcdc

commit_message:
Added new repo for fuel-plugin-datera-cinder

This is yet another fuel plugin repository created
under Openstack namespace.

This project met the following criteria:
- development of the plugin has already started under private repo,
- code is available under the open source license,
- current repository do not contain any binary files,
- plugin supports more than one Fuels version.

Current repository for the plugin can be access under the following
url: https://github.com/snuf/fuel-plugin-datera-cinder

Change-Id: Iaae95b740266e6c2b9159e7045fcc819f8681380
Closes-Bug: #1549594

commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs for tripleo-ci

We don't branch tripleo-ci, but it is used on all of the tripleo
project branches.  We should be running tests against the stable
branches on every proposed change so we don't accidentally break
them.

Only adding the ha and nonha jobs since they test significantly
different features, and 7 jobs is already a lot to get passing
at once.  The upgrades job isn't going to be testing much on ci
changes since there's no upgrade impact to any of those, and we've
still got the master upgrades job to ensure we don't make any
breaking changes to the job as a whole.

Change-Id: I56a84ab20ae8d4e1317497b302348185d7d8d4af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/90/297390/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: tripleo-ci jobs: # tripleo-ci is branchless, so we need to test changes against all the # stable branches as well. - '{trigger}-tripleo-ci-{jobname}': jobname: 'f22-nonha' type: 'nonha' node: 'tripleo-f22' trigger: 'gate' branch-override: 'stable/liberty' - '{trigger}-tripleo-ci-{jobname}': jobname: 'f22-ha' type: 'ha' node: 'tripleo-f22' trigger: 'gate' branch-override: 'stable/liberty' - '{trigger}-tripleo-ci-{jobname}': jobname: 'f22-upgrades' type: 'upgrades' node: 'tripleo-f22' trigger: 'gate' branch-override: 'stable/liberty' - project:

commit_message:

added_lines: ====================================== VPN-as-a-Service configuration options ====================================== Use the following options in the ``vpnaas_agent.ini`` file for the VPNaaS agent. .. include:: ../tables/neutron-vpnaas.rst .. include:: ../tables/neutron-vpnaas_ipsec.rst .. include:: ../tables/neutron-vpnaas_openswan.rst .. include:: ../tables/neutron-vpnaas_strongswan.rst .. note:: ``strongSwan`` and ``Openswan`` cannot both be installed and enabled at the same time. The ``vpn_device_driver`` configuration option in the ``vpnaas_agent.ini`` file is an option that lists the VPN device drivers that the Networking service will use. You must choose either ``strongSwan`` or ``Openswan`` as part of the list. .. important:: Ensure that your ``strongSwan`` version is 5 or newer. To declare either one in the ``vpn_device_driver``: .. code-block:: ini #Openswan vpn_device_driver = ['neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.device_drivers.ipsec.OpenSwanDriver'] #strongSwan vpn_device_driver = ['neutron.services.vpn.device_drivers.strongswan_ipsec.StrongSwanDriver']

commit_message:
Rearrange lcm tests

Idempotency and ensurability tests have the general
base test which prepares environment.
So, their combination in the same groups
optimizes run of these tests

commit_message:
Add event_id for alarm-history display

We only shows timestamp, type, and detail when calling alarm-history show;
As for the pagination implementation, alarm-history can only marked using
event_id, so it is not easy to use for CLI users, we should also provide
event_id when we display the results.

Change-Id: I2f8cf1d2dd9d6ddf28652ad8ccb4a25d2ec1082b
Closes-bug: #1589480

commit_message:
Remove locks from Pure volume drivers

If we switch to using a retry and are more careful about handling errors
when a host is deleted or volumes are attached we dont need to use the
lock.

For initialize_connection time when we go to create a host we run the
risk that a terminate_connection running in parallel deleted our host
from underneath us before the volume was attached. To handle that we
just catch the error in that scenario and try to create the host again.

The second issue for initialize_connection is if we try to create a host
and another initialize_connection running in parallel beats us to it. If
the host already exists we can catch the exception for create_host(..)
and retry, which will give us the existing one.

For terminate_connection time we run the risk that between when we
determine a host to be ready for deletion and actually deleting it a
new volume is attached. We can just swallow this error since the Purity
management API will not allow to delete a host with connected volumes.

Change-Id: I8ae75dab279bb983a31595b6af6105a933d5c72c
Closes-Bug: #1588089

commit_message:
Give more fine grained access to DriverInitiatorData

Previously we were setting a whole model update, whereas now we only
do one value at a time. This will allow for easier handling of doing
the insert if not exist and reporting back what happened.

The older method to do this was better suited to the model_update from
initialize_connection, but we dont need a all-in-one kind of method
anymore.

Change-Id: I57778f1807d1814c536d62757d6ad10c920b6101
Closes-Bug: #1588088

commit_message:
Remove test_conf.py

These tests were introduced as least in Havana in a patch
If293d36a9e1552f7af497edf947e82458488bf9c. We moved to oslo.config
some time ago, so we don't need test oslo.config in cinder too.

Fix port validator

A recent change in netutils now allows a port number 0
as valid port number. This made tests fail.

commit_message:
[networking] Backport subnet pools and address scope documents

Documents on subnet pools and address scopes in the master branch
are about Mitaka release. There is no reason to backport them.

The following four commits are cherry-picked.
----
Document Neutron subnet pools

Subnet Pools are not a new feature.  It has been available since Kilo.
However, it is under-documented (API docs only).  It is a neat and
simple feature that people are likely to find useful.

(cherry picked from commit c4076d231aed5467c3012ddc3a383821da69702f)
----
Document Neutron address scopes

(cherry picked from commit 55477393343aefaeb7a5e44c5310c68b408c277c)
----
[network] Clean up address scopes section

Streamline introduction and first section. Fix grammar in intro section.
Fix text-wrapping. Add numbering to use case section.

Closes-bug: #1581455
backport: mitaka

(cherry picked from commit c9a4407db060ddfc31fdc26d74b7b512e4bfa90d)
----
Use the correct capitalization of OpenStack

(cherry picked from commit 7bce82fe01e939a557f5deed226fb92d1c8c377f)
----

Change-Id: I485b4bf7ed3567bc0cb17518c0c415b05f711fc2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/01/330201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup exceptions in tempest

There is a number of exceptions available in tempest.lib which are duplicated
in the exceptions module in tempest. They are all identitical, except for one:
TimeoutException. The tempest.lib version inherits from RestClientException,
while the tempest version is a TempestException. The only class that should
use the former is the RestClient (and derivative), while it is used by ssh
client as well. Changing the type of exception raised by ssh.py would be a
backward incompatible change, so I think we cannot change this now.

Change-Id: I98ad80266b00f7d0b9d269a516866d81312aa834

commit_message:
Add unittest for node recover with unsupported operations

Bug #1590255 fixed by commit 2bf66dc61d0ffb3d8e8ed4726bd3770c9d3af014.
This patch only adds unittest to verify node recover function
as expected when passing unsupported operations.

Change-Id: I63751dcf6e48f7e1c21de8784053bfa520997cf1
Closes-Bug: #1590255

commit_message:
Trivial: Fix incorrect import order in volume

This could be a miss when we use osc_lib first in OSC.
We should import python standard libs first, and then
openstack related libs. This is not a bug and the CI
will pass even if without this patch. This is just a
trivial fix.

Change-Id: Ib3926afe1c96272870ae9765fb79cfe29ab51fef

commit_message:
Add pagination support in Aodhclient

Aodh now supports pagination. We should add it for
aodh client.

Change-Id: Ia0163cf1330dfec8880058c88966263c2e971f3c
Closes-Bug: #1538927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-aodhclient refs/changes/94/321394/23 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument("--limit", type=int, metavar="<LIMIT>", help="Number of resources to return " "(Default is server default)") parser.add_argument("--marker", metavar="<MARKER>", help="Last item of the previous listing. " "Return the next results after this value") parser.add_argument("--sort", action="append", metavar="<SORT>", help="Sort of resource attribute ") alarms = utils.get_client(self).alarm.list( query=query, filters=filters, **self._get_pagination_options(parsed_args)) @staticmethod def _get_pagination_options(parsed_args): options = dict( details=parsed_args.details, sorts=parsed_args.sort, limit=parsed_args.limit, marker=parsed_args.marker) return options
